messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On July 25, DET. T. U. Wilson responded to a report of vandalism at the Liberty Museum. Primary informants were Dr. Martinez, the museum curator, and Ms. Turner, a museum guard. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. V. W. Parker - OPERATIONS Det. Wilson, Sr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective X. Y. Adams and Detective Z. A. Brooks checked for signs of forced entry. BLACK 09:15 Vandalism Dr. Martinez listed damaged artifacts, while Ms. Turner described the previous night's security details. Photo. Technician Richard captured images of the damage. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Wilson Sr, Det. Adams, Det. Brooks OPERATIONS Lt. Parker INFORMANT Turner, Lisa 145 Spruce Lane, Liberty, Oklahoma 213-1010. 94655. BLACK 09:15 Vandalism By 11:45 AM, Detectives Wilson, Adams, and Brooks, under Lieutenant Parker's guidance, identified potential entry points. Captain B. C. Davis proposed enhancing museum security measures. Sergeant D. E. Evans and Sergeant F. G. Ford collaborated with the city's historical preservation department. By 1:20 PM, a plan was set to restore and protect the artifacts. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Wilson Sr, Det. Adams, Det. Brooks OPERATIONS Lt. Parker AFFIDAVIT - Vandalism Report 1) Artifact Catalog 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Security Logs 5) Museum Floor Plans (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE H. White L.M.P.D. 36.150 P82 3875 Martinez, RACHEL NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 210-4175 DETECTIVE: T. WILSON ITEM: 82-5750- 113 CRIME: 09:15 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 85050 - CONFIRMED John Doe DATE 1/14/25 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. T. U. Wilson  Officer Context: On July 25, DET. T. U. Wilson responded to a report of vandalism at the Liberty Museum. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. V. W. Parker  Officer Context: Lt. V. W. Parker - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective X. Y. Adams  Officer Context: Detective X. Y. Adams and Detective Z. A. Brooks checked for signs of forced entry. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Z. A. Brooks  Officer Context: Detective X. Y. Adams and Detective Z. A. Brooks checked for signs of forced entry. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Richard  Officer Context: Photo. Technician Richard captured images of the damage. Officer Role: Technician (from the Crime Lab) Officer Name: Detective Wilson  Officer Context: By 11:45 AM, Detectives Wilson, Adams, and Brooks, under Lieutenant Parker's guidance, identified potential entry points. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Adams  Officer Context: By 11:45 AM, Detectives Wilson, Adams, and Brooks, under Lieutenant Parker's guidance, identified potential entry points. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Brooks  Officer Context: By 11:45 AM, Detectives Wilson, Adams, and Brooks, under Lieutenant Parker's guidance, identified potential entry points. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain B. C. Davis  Officer Context: Captain B. C. Davis proposed enhancing museum security measures. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant D. E. Evans  Officer Context: Sergeant D. E. Evans and Sergeant F. G. Ford collaborated with the city's historical preservation department. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant F. G. Ford Officer Context: Sergeant D. E. Evans and Sergeant F. G. Ford collaborated with the city's historical preservation department. Officer Role: Sergeant
